required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PREPARE-CALC-COMBO: Severely Calcified Coronary Lesions Prepared With Rotational Atherectomy and Modified Balloons
clinical_study.official_title: The Evaluation of a Strategy to PREPARE Severely CALCified Coronary Lesions With a Combination Of Rotational Atherectomy and Modified BallOons Trial (PREPARE-CALC- COMBO)

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective single-arm trial of rotational atherectomy in combination with cutting balloon in severely calcified coronary lesions.

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective single-arm trial to evaluate the acute and long term efficacy of a combined strategy of lesion preparation with rotational atherectomy followed by cutting balloon and by hybrid sirolimus-eluting stent implantation in an angiographically well-defined group of patients with severely calcified coronary lesions.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary endpoint: Numerical in-stent acute lumen gain in mm
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the index procedure
primary_outcome.description: The main angiographic endpoint will be in-stent acute lumen gain defined as minimal lumen diameter (MLD) in stent at the end of the index procedure minus baseline MLD.

primary_outcome.measure: Co-primary OCT endpoint: Ratio of stent expansion index (SEI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the index procedure
primary_outcome.description: The main OCT endpoint will be stent expansion index (SEI), defined as minimum stent area divided by mean reference area in optical coherence tomography (OCT) quantitative analysis at the end of the index procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Numerical in-stent late lumen loss at 9 month follow-up angiography in mm
secondary_outcome.description: In-stent late lumen loss at 9 month follow-up angiography defined as the difference between the postprocedure in-stent minimal lumen diameter (MLD)and the in-stent MLD at 9-month followup angiography will be adopted as a co-primary endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of angiographic success in percent
secondary_outcome.description: 'Angiographic Success' defined as successful stent delivery and expansion with attainment of < 20% in-stent residual stenosis of the target lesion in the presence of TIMI 3 flow.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of strategy success in percent
secondary_outcome.description: 'Strategy Success' defined as successful stent delivery and expansion with attainment of < 20% in-stent residual stenosis of the target lesion in the presence of TIMI 3 flow without stent failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of target vessel failure in percent
secondary_outcome.description: Target vessel failure (TVF) defined as a composite of cardiac death, target vessel related myocardial infarction and clinically driven target vessel revascularization at 9 months, 1 and 2 years.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of in-segment binary restenosis at 9 months in percent
Rate of stent thrombosis in percent
Rate of peri-procedural myocardial infarction in percent
Rate of vessel perforation in percent
Numerical contrast dye amount in ml

other_outcome.measure: Ratio of OCT-measured stent excentricity index
other_outcome.description: Defined as the ratio of minimal lumen diameter and the maximal lumen diameter per cross section at the end of index procedure

arm_group.description: Rotational atherectomy in combination with cutting balloon in severely calcified coronary lesions

intervention.intervention_name: Rotational atherectomy in combination with cutting balloon
intervention.description: Treatment of severely calcified coronary lesion using rotational atherectomy followed by balloon angioplasty using a cutting balloon and Implantation of the hybrid sirolimus-eluting stent.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with coronary artery disease subjected to percutaneous revascularization of the native coronary arteries and fullfilling all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Clinical inclusion criteria
1. Age above 18 years and consentable
2. Angiographically proven coronary artery disease
3. Anginal symptoms and/or reproducible ischemia in the target area by ECG, functional stress testing or fractional flow reserve
4. Written informed consent
Angiographic inclusion criteria
1. De-novo lesion in a native coronary artery
2. Target reference vessel diameter between 2.25 and 4.0 mm by visual estimation
3. Luminal diameter reduction of 50-100% by visual estimation
4. Severe calcification of the target lesion (for definition see appendix)
Exclusion Criteria:
Clinical exclusion criteria
1. Myocardial infarction (within 1 week)
2. Decompensated heart failure
3. Limited long term prognosis due to other conditions
Angiographic exclusion criteria
1. Target lesion is in a coronary artery bypass graft
2. Target lesion is an in-stent restenosis
3. Target vessel thrombus
